text: At a Vancouver news conference about Wuhan #coronavirus (#covid19), where she is backed by #ufwd ally Hilbert Yiu, Trudeau-appointed health minister @PattyHajdu lauds China and says Canada will not close its borders. #cdnpoli #bcpoli #vanpoli #richmondbc https://t.co/K7Gg68wEyK

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

entity.name: French journalists show life in China amid the coronavirus outbreak
entity.description: Correspondents based in China for French news publications Le Figaro, Les Echos and France 2 have been reporting from the frontlines of the coronavirus crisis in Wuhan as well as from the capital city Beijing. Their photos and videos highlight the Chinese government's response to the outbreak, the nouveau "ghost towns" and the measures people are taking to avoid catching the illness.

entity.name: Canada will evacuate its citizens on board quarantined cruise ship in Japan
entity.description: The government of Canada announced that it has chartered a plane to repatriate Canadians on board the Diamond Princess cruise ship, which has been docked in Yokohama, Japan, since February 3. There are over 250 Canadians on board the ship and 15 of them have been infected with the virus.
